original: LARSON, Oscar Ivar (Ivar O), Direktör, Stockholm, f Ramnäs 20/7 80 av bruksäg O L o Helena Karlsson, gm Karin Lindman. Studex öbr 99, KTH 99—02. Ing Hallstahamm br 03—06, dir.ass Sv arb.giv.frn 06, 2. dir 18, v. vkst dir sed. 29. Ordf jvgsstyr :s överläggn m jvgsbyggn.arb 08, led soc rådet 22—37, arb.domst sed. 29, arb.fredskomm 26—32, arb.-markn.kommiss sed. 36, 36 års semestersakk, de nord arb.giv.frn :as perman utsk sed. 26, de sv arb.giv.frn :as fört.råd sed. 19, deleg int arb.konf Geneve 23—33, led deleg f int soc.polit samarb sed. 27, ordf komm f arb.hj åt Finl 40. Styr.led Hallstah AB 06, ordf sed. 30, styr.led Sv arb.giv.frn 18—29, v. ordf Frn f arb.skydd sed. 29, ordf Sv chokl.ind.frb sed. 38, styr.led Vapenbröderna sed. 35. Av trycket: Om s k syndik arb.rör, särsk i Frankr (10), Den syndik arb.rör o dess bekämp (11), Glasind i Tyskl, Frankr o Belg (reseberätt 13), Om lagstadgad arb.semester (20), Koll.-avt:s betyd i sv ind, Lönenivån inom Sv:s ind, Sv småglasbr.frb 08—33 mm. KVO2kl, KFVROlkl, KBKrO, RDDO, Sv brig M mm. Hobby: Genealogi.
translated: LARSON, Oscar Ivar (Ivar O), Director, Stockholm, born in Ramnäs on July 20th, 1880, the son of industrialist O L and Helena Karlsson, married to Karin Lindman. Started studies in 1899, graduated from KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) in 1902. Engineer at Hallstahammar Ironworks from 1903 to 1906, assistant director at the Swedish Employers' Federation from 1906, second director from 1918, deputy director since 1929. Chairman of the Highway Board's negotiation committee on road construction work since 1908, member of the Social Council from 1922 to 1937, member of the Labor Court since 1929, member of the Labor Peace Committee from 1926 to 1932, member of the Labor Market Commission since 1936, examiner for the 1936 industrial vacation schedule, permanent member of the Nordic Employers' Federation from 1926, member of the Swedish Employers' Federation's executive council since 1919, delegation member to the International Labor Conference in Geneva from 1923 to 1933, member of the delegation for international social and political cooperation since 1927, chairman of the Labor Aid Commission for Finland in 1940. Board member of Hallstahammar AB since 1906, chairman since 1930, board member of the Swedish Employers' Federation from 1918 to 1929, vice chairman of the Women's Labor Protection Society since 1929, chairman of the Swedish Chocolate Industry Association since 1938, board member of the Vapenbröderna (Weapon Brothers) since 1935. Published works: About the so-called syndicalist labor movement, especially in France (1910), The syndicalist labor movement and its combating (1911), Glass industry in Germany, France, and Belgium (travel report 1913), About statutory labor vacation (1920), The importance of collective agreements in the Swedish industry, Wage levels within the Swedish industry, Swedish small glassware association from 1908 to 1933, and more. Knight of the Order of Vasa, Knight of the Order of the Polar Star, Knight of the Order of the Sword, Commander of the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav, Swedish brigadier, etc. Hobby: Genealogy.
